steps.name: the admin user goes to the Tool Builder admin page
a tool definition called "Test Tool" exists
a tool definition called "Test Tool 2" exists
the user selects "Test Tool 2" as default tool definition
the name of the selected tool definition is "Test Tool 2"
she goes to the Tool Instances Navigation Page
the name of the tool definition is "Test Tool 2"
the admin user goes to the Tool Builder admin page
a tool definition called "Test Tool" exists
a tool definition called "Test Tool 2" exists
the user selects "Test Tool" as default tool definition
the name of the selected tool definition is "Test Tool"
she goes to the Tool Instances Navigation Page
the name of the tool definition is "Test Tool"

name: Choosing Tool Definition
description:
As the admin user
I want to choose the Tool Definition for the system
So that I can use work with it

steps.name: the admin user is on the Tool Builder admin page
she chooses to create a new tool definition
she provides the tool definition name as "Mock Tool Type"
she returns to the Tool Definition admin page
a tool definition called "Mock Tool Type" exists
the admin user is on the Tool Builder admin page
she chooses to create a new tool definition
she provides the tool definition name as "My New Tool Type"
she adds a step of type MOCK
she adds a step of type MOCK
she adds a step of type MOCK
she returns to the Tool Definition admin page
a tool definition called "My New Tool Type" exists
the user selects "My New Tool Type" as default tool definition
the user is on the Tool Instances Navigation Page
she logs in the system as test@guerrillamail.com with password test
the name of the tool definition is "My New Tool Type"
the user creates a tool instance called "My New Tool Def Instance"
she selects the tool instance "My New Tool Def Instance"
she chooses to step forward
she chooses to step forward
she chooses to step forward
she chooses to step forward
she returns to the Tool Instances Navigation Page
the tool instance called "My New Tool Def Instance" is on step 3
the admin user is on the Tool Builder admin page
a tool definition called "My New Tool Type" exists
she chooses to create a new tool definition
she provides the tool definition name as "My New Tool Type"
an error message with text "Tool Definition called "My New Tool Type" already exists" is shown

arguments.val: Tool Definition called "My New Tool Type" already exists

elements.name: Try to create an existing Tool Definition and change the name

steps.name: the admin user is on the Tool Builder admin page
a tool definition called "My New Tool Type" exists
she chooses to create a new tool definition
she provides the tool definition name as "My New Tool Type"
an error message with text "Tool Definition called "My New Tool Type" already exists" is shown

arguments.val: Tool Definition called "My New Tool Type" already exists

steps.name: she provides the tool definition name as "My New Tool Type 2"
she adds a step of type MOCK
she adds a step of type MOCK
she returns to the Tool Definition admin page
a tool definition called "My New Tool Type 2" exists

name: Tool Definition Management
description:
As the admin user
I want to create new Tool Definitions in the system
So that I can choose them as the system Tool Definition

steps.name: the admin user is on the Tool Builder admin page
a tool definition called "My New Tool Type 2" exists
the user chooses to edit the tool definition called "My New Tool Type 2"
she adds a step of type MOCK
she moves the step 2 to step 3
she saves the steps order
she returns to the Tool Definition admin page
a tool definition called "My New Tool Type 2" exists

name: Tool Definition Management
description:
As the admin user
I want to edit existing Tool Definitions in the system
So that I can choose them as the system Tool Definition

steps.name: the admin user is on the Tool Builder admin page
a tool definition called "My New Tool Type 2" exists
a tool definition called "Mock Tool Type" exists
she selects to delete the tool definition called "My New Tool Type 2"
she confirms the deletion
she selects to delete the tool definition called "Mock Tool Type"
she confirms the deletion
a tool definition called "My New Tool Type 2" does not exist
a tool definition called "Mock Tool Type" does not exist

name: Tool Definition Management
description:
As the admin user
I want to edit existing Tool Definitions in the system
So that I can choose them as the system Tool Definition

elements.name: Try to edit or delete the selected Tool Definition with tool instances associated

steps.name: the admin user is on the Tool Builder admin page
the name of the selected tool definition is "My New Tool Type"
a tooltip message with text "unselect-or-delete-instances-to-configure-delete-tooldef" is shown for the buttons on tool definition "My New Tool Type"
the button to delete the tool definition called "My New Tool Type" is disabled
the button to configure the tool definition called "My New Tool Type" is disabled

elements.name: Try to edit or delete a non-selected Tool Definition with tool instances associated

steps.name: the user is on the Tool Instances Navigation Page
a tool instance called "My New Tool Def Instance" exists
the admin user goes to the Tool Builder admin page
she selects "Test Tool 2" as default tool definition
a tooltip message with text "unselect-or-delete-instances-to-configure-delete-tooldef" is shown for the buttons on tool definition "My New Tool Type"
the button to delete the tool definition called "My New Tool Type" is disabled
the button to configure the tool definition called "My New Tool Type" is disabled

elements.name: Try to edit or delete the selected Tool Definition without tool instances associated

steps.name: the user is on the Tool Instances Navigation Page
there are no Tool Instances
the admin user goes to the Tool Builder admin page
the name of the selected tool definition is "Test Tool 2"
a tooltip message with text "unselect-or-delete-instances-to-configure-delete-tooldef" is shown for the buttons on tool definition "Test Tool 2"
the button to delete the tool definition called "Test Tool 2" is disabled
the button to configure the tool definition called "Test Tool 2" is disabled

elements.name: Delete associated tool instances, deselect and delete an existing Tool Definition

steps.name: the admin user is on the Tool Builder admin page
she selects "My New Tool Type" as default tool definition
she goes to the Tool Instances Navigation Page
a tool instance called "My New Tool Def Instance" exists
the user selects the tool instance "My New Tool Def Instance"
she deletes the current tool instance
she logs out
the admin user goes to the Tool Builder admin page
a tooltip message with text "unselect-or-delete-instances-to-configure-delete-tooldef" is shown for the buttons on tool definition "My New Tool Type"
the user selects "Test Tool" as default tool definition
the button to delete the tool definition called "My New Tool Type" is enabled
the button to configure the tool definition called "My New Tool Type" is enabled
she selects to delete the tool definition called "My New Tool Type"
she confirms the deletion
a tool definition called "My New Tool Type" does not exist

name: Tool Definition Management
description:
As the admin user
I don't want to edit or delete a Tool Definition selected or with exisiting tool instances
So the system should avoid it
